result.execSummary:
The defendant Wendell Kevin Staten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Oxycodone), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
With release privileges to the Day Reporting Center. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Defendant to attend an Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment program or sobriety support group once per week.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. No drug paraphernalia, use for packaging for the delivery of the controlled substance.
Seek and maintain full time work. Participate in GED or HSED program.

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the probation agent during the course of probation. Any remaining balance upon release of probation shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
No possession of any firearms ammunition. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Participate in Parenting Class. Provide DNA sample, if not already done. Comply with paying the Department of Correction supervision fees.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time credit, and without any release privileges. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Condition time is imposed and stayed, but shall be imposed by the Department of Corrections  as follows: 
20 days for the 1st violation of a positive drug or alcohol test, 30 days for the 2nd violation of a positive drug or alcohol test, and 40 days for a third violation of a positive drug or alcohol test.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wendell Kevin Staten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order, signed and filed.
The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent, specifically noting that the defendant was given the opportunity for community supervision on probation and the probation was revoked. 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( x ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  12/30/2014          Initials: sm

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, with release privileges to the Day Reporting Center, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 46 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months. 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to attend an Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment program or sobriety support group once per week. 
- No drug paraphernalia, use for packaging for the delivery of the controlled substance. 
- No possession of any firearms ammunition. 
- Seek and maintain full time work. 
- Participate in GED or HSED program. 
- Participate in Parenting Class. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Comply with paying the Department of Correction supervision fees. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the probation agent during the course of probation. Any remaining balance upon release of probation shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
- Court orders 90 days condition time, without good time credit, and without any release privileges. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Condition time is imposed and stayed, but shall be imposed by the Department of Corrections  as follows: 
20 days for the 1st violation of a positive drug or alcohol test, 30 days for the 2nd violation of a positive drug or alcohol test, and 40 days for a third violation of a positive drug or alcohol test. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Wendell Kevin Staten in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Wendell Kevin Staten in custody.  Brandon A. Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT  1: 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Case proceeds to Sentencing.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Wendell Kevin Staten not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing 9-11-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders a turn over to Jusice Point. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Attorney Alexis Ray Liggins in court, defendant Wendell Kevin Staten not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court proceeds to Bail Bond Hearing. Arguments heard by both the State and Defense.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served. Original in Court file.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Fail not forfeited at this time.

Defendant Wendell Kevin Staten in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-05-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wendell Kevin Staten in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wendell Kevin Staten in court with Michael Beckman, student intern under the supervision of attorney Alexis Liggins.  Step Nolten for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 1/27/14.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Wendell Kevin Staten in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Wendell Kevin Staten in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
